title: Mark Mouland
text:
Mark Mouland (born 23 April 1961) is a <a href="Wales">Welsh</a> professional <a href="golf">golf</a>er.
Mouland was born in <a href="St.%20Athan">St. Athan</a> in the <a href="Vale%20of%20Glamorgan">Vale of Glamorgan</a>, and is the son of six times Welsh champion <a href="Sid%20Mouland">Sid Mouland</a>. In 1976, he became the youngest ever winner of the British Boys Championship. He turned professional in 1981.
By 1986, Mouland was well established on the <a href="European%20Tour">European Tour</a>, winning that year's <a href="Car%20Care%20Plan%20International">Car Care Plan International</a> and finishing 30th on the Order of Merit. He broke his right ankle and left foot in a car crash later that year, but recovered to record the only two top-20 Order of Merit finishes of his career in 1987 (16th) and 1988 (18th). The 1988 <a href="KLM%20Dutch%20Open">KLM Dutch Open</a> was his second and last win on the European Tour. He maintained steady form for many years, last finishing in the top hundred on the Order of Merit in 2001.
Mouland continued to compete into his mid forties, but mainly on the second tier <a href="Challenge%20Tour">Challenge Tour</a>. He also won the <a href="Mauritius%20Open">Mauritius Open</a> in 2002 and 2003.
Mouland began playing on the <a href="European%20Senior%20Tour">European Senior Tour</a> after turning 50 in April 2011. He won his first title at the <a href="Belas%20Clube%20de%20Campo%20Senior%20Open%20de%20Portugal">Belas Clube de Campo Senior Open de Portugal</a> in October 2011. He will play on the <a href="Champions%20Tour">Champions Tour</a> in 2013 after finishing 3rd at <a href="Qualifying%20school">Qualifying school</a> in November 2012.
